clinical_study.brief_title: Moral Judgements and Choices of Healthcare Professionals in the Time of COVID-19 Pandemic
clinical_study.official_title: Moral Judgements and Choices of Healthcare Professionals in the Time of COVID-19 Pandemic : MORAL-X-PHI-COVID-19-phase2

brief_summary.textblock: The XPHI-COVID19-2 randomized study aims to investigate the moral choices of caregivers and of layout population in a context of scarce resources.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period
primary_outcome.description: Score on the Impartial Beneficence subscale of the Oxford Utilitarianism Scale (IB-OUS) Minimum - maximum value : 5 - 35 points The higher the value is, the more the participant is willing to maximize the happiness of the population at the cost of individual sacrifices.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period
secondary_outcome.description: Score on the Instrumental Harm subscale of the Oxford Utilitarianism Scale (IH-OUS) Minimum - maximum value : 4 - 28 points The higher the value is, the more the participant is willing to save one person over the happiness of the population.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period
secondary_outcome.description: Bi-dimensional scale of utilitarian thinking. Minimum - maximum value : 9 - 63 points The higher the value is, the more the participant have an utilitarian thinking.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period
secondary_outcome.description: Propensity to promote and reward prospective instrumental value, based on current and future facts, in the questions exploring this moral value

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period
secondary_outcome.description: Propensity to promote and reward retrospective instrumental value, based on current and future facts, in the questions exploring this moral value

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period
secondary_outcome.description: Impartial assignment of resources in the questions exploring this moral value

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period
secondary_outcome.description: Propensity to prioritize the youngest person in the questions exploring this moral value

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period
secondary_outcome.description: Propensity to save life years in the questions exploring this moral value

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period
secondary_outcome.description: Propensity to save most lifes in the questions exploring this moral value

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period
secondary_outcome.description: Propensity to treat people equally in the questions exploring this moral value

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the inclusion period
secondary_outcome.description: Propensity to prioritize the worst off in the questions exploring this moral value

arm_group.description: The participants have to read ethical guidelines before the assessment of their pro-utilitarian tendencies with the Oxford Utilitarianism Scale and before they have been asked to resolve moral dilemmas.

The participants do not have to read ethical guidelines before the assessment of their pro-utilitarian tendencies with the Oxford Utilitarianism Scale and before they have been asked to resolve moral dilemmas.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Caregivers
- Individuals from general population
Exclusion Criteria:
- Withdrawal of agreement
